data.question: What are the three families of ester-based solid polymer electrolytes (SPEs) investigated in the study?
data.answer: Polycarbonate electrolytes (PCE), polyoxalate electrolytes (POE), and polymalonate electrolytes (PME)

data.question: Why do SPEs made from pentanediol have higher Li+-conductivity compared to those made from butanediol?
data.answer: Due to the enhanced asymmetry and flexibility of the pentanediol-based polymer structures.

data.question: True or False: The trifluoroacetyl-units are more effective than TF-diol units in stabilizing the interface with Li-metal.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the main reason for the poor cycling stability of ASS Li/NCM622 cells using C5-PME-F as SPE?
data.answer: Due to the enol isomerization of malonate units.

data.question: How is the cycling stability of Li/PME/NCM622 cells improved?
data.answer: By introducing a dimethyl-group in malonate and suppressing enol isomerization.

data.question: True or False: The Li+-conductivity of PME and POE is around 10 and 5 times of PCE, respectively.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the role of elemental F in the SPEs?
data.answer: To in situ construct a passivating solid-electrolyte-interlayer (SEI) by the reduction of Li-metal.

data.question: True or False: The ASS Li/Li cells using C5-PCE-F-Li, C5-POE-F-Li, and C5-PME-F-Li deliver stable cycling up to 1000 hours.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the effect of changing from C4-diol to C5-diol in PCE/POE/PME?
data.answer: It increases the variations in length and configuration between carbonate/oxalate/malonate units and diol segments, facilitating the improvement of Li+-conductivity.

data.question: True or False: The ASS Li/NCM622 cells using C5-PME-F-Li showed severe capacity fading due to the stable interface with Li-metal.
data.answer: False

data.question: What modification is made to PME to suppress enol isomerization?
data.answer: Introducing a dimethyl-group in malonate.

data.question: True or False: The thermal stability of SPEs is not affected by the presence of LiTFSI.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the main challenge in the development of high-performance solid-state electrolytes for ASS cells?
data.answer: The poor interfacial contact and large interfacial resistance between the inorganic electrolyte and electrode membrane.

data.question: True or False: The introduction of a dimethyl-group in PME results in higher Li+-conductivity compared to POE.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the main advantage of using solid polymer electrolytes (SPEs) in all-solid-state batteries?
data.answer: They offer higher flexibility, better interfacial contact, and easier large-scale production compared to inorganic ceramic/glass electrolytes.

data.question: True or False: The HOMO and LUMO energy levels of SPEs determine their mechanical properties.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the significance of the trifluoroacetyl-units in SPEs?
data.answer: They protect the highly reactive OH units, generate a LiF-based SEI passivating layer, and stabilize the interface with Li-metal.

data.question: True or False: The ASS Li/NCM622 cells using DM-C5-PME-F-Li show improved cycling stability compared to those using C5-PME-F-Li.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the main focus of previous studies on SPEs?
data.answer: Polyether-based SPEs like PEO (poly(ethylene oxide)) and P-PEGMA (poly(poly(ethylene glycol)methacrylate)), which show high Li+-conductivity and good compatibility with Li-metal.

data.question: True or False: The introduction of elemental F on SPE polymer chains is aimed at improving the mechanical strength of the electrolyte.
data.answer: False
